Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2010 11:14AM tania73 wrote: hi ladies, i am on my 11 cycle of xeloda 4000mg per day 14 on 7 off and have had miner side effects yes dry and cracking hand and feet, i swear by sorbolene and plenty of water. have had great results on xeloda mets to lungs have gone and mets to bones are shrinking and stable at present. i have a review in a few  weeks to see what next. regards to all happy new year tania
Posts.Title: WHO HAS DONE WELL ON XELODA imbell Rich66

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 05:16AM tania73 wrote: Hi Laurie, we are in the same boat, I was dx dec 05 at age 32 bc 1/11nodes to right breast went through the ringer surgery mast/recon/reduction chemo 12 cycles was pregnant at the time had to terminate at 12wks before starting chemo. was in remission for 3 years, had my yearly check up to find mets to lungs, bones widespread, lymph nodes. no surgery now am on my 3 cycle of chemo navelbine no side affects besided hair thinning, 2weeks on 2 weeks off, zometa,zoladex monthly bones ache a bit slight tingle to fingers being monitored, as i am hormone receptive and brac2+, will have review early feb after 6th cycle to see whats happening.  when i was first told it had metastasised i got onto the internet to read up on this f#ing monkey on my back, i think it was the worst thing to do, i read the stats and thought i better start digging my grave because im going to die tomorrow, wont do that again then i searched for forums like this and if a want  can communicate with my peers that are going through this as well and found it a hell of alot more comforting that there are many of us out there who are doing fine and we can live life to the fullest, although it will be a continueous battle.I have three children ,8,7,(5mths yes was naieve had to have the 3rd child i was robbed of, hinesight! but woulded trade her for the world), i have told my 8 and 7 year olds that mum is sick again they dont really understand the significants of it all. will chat soon chin up  be brave  Tania

Posts.Content: tania73 wrote: hi, this is my first time, so please bear with me, i have just been diagnosed with bc lung/bone mets i am 35 and diagnosed with bc at 32, i am so confused and lost at the moment as i have a very young family 3 mths, 6, 8 and i wish to god i could predict the future to know how long i have got to live,  i said to my husband i could die by stats in 18/24 months can anyone give my some idease to combat this i will be starting chemo on monday, as this is hormone+ , brac2, Dx 12/5/2005, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 1/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
